original: B. It is the desire and intention of both parties that WCC cooperates with XLI in the marketing and promotion of XLI products and technology ("PROMOTION").
ollama_generated: A. It is the mutual preference and understanding of both parties that WCC shall voluntarily collaborate with XLI in the advertisement and dissemination of XLI goods and innovations, hereafter referred to as "PROMOTIONAL ACTIVITIES." Notwithstanding this cooperation, WCC is under no compulsion or obligation to invest resources beyond its discretion.

original: 1.1.1 WCC grants a limited, non-exclusive license to XLI to use the West Coast Customs name, image, likeness and signature, including specific West Coast Customs Trademarks (including West Coast Customs logo trademarks and approved West Coast Customs vehicle imagery and trademarks) (collectively the "Trademarks") during the term of this Agreement in connection with national, regional or local print advertising, together with Internet, television, video and on-site event advertising, only in connection with the PROMOTION, subject to all of the terms and conditions hereof. This license shall terminate automatically upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, at which time XLI shall cease all use of the Trademarks. In further consideration of this Agreement, XLI shall not in any way disparage the Trademarks, nor any of WCC's parent, subsidiary, or affiliated companies' trademarks or its or their products. WCC shall provide XLI with all applicable logos and usage guidelines for the Trademarks. WCC shall have the right of prior written approval over all uses of the Trademarks by XLI. The parties understand and acknowledge the importance of protecting the goodwill associated with their respective trademarks. Consequently, XLI hereby assigns to WCC all goodwill and all other rights developed in connection with XLI's use of WCC's trademarks which shall inure to the benefit of WCC.
ollama_generated:
1.1.1 In consideration of this Agreement, WCC grants XLI a non-exclusive, limited license to utilize the West Coast Customs name, image, likeness, and signature, along with designated West Coast Customs Trademarks (including but not limited to the West Coast Customs logo trademarks, approved West Coast Customs vehicle imagery, and trademarks) (collectively the "Trademarks"). This license is extended for the duration of this Agreement, allowing XLI to employ the Trademarks in national, regional, or local print advertising, as well as Internet, television, video, and on-site event advertising. However, these uses are strictly limited to promoting XLI's own products and services, not those of WCC or any of its affiliated companies.

Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, XLI is required to discontinue all use of the Trademarks. XLI shall ensure that no disparagement of the Trademarks or any of WCC's parent, subsidiary, or affiliated companies' trademarks, or their respective products, occurs during the course of this Agreement. WCC will provide XLI with applicable logos and usage guidelines for the Trademarks. Notably, WCC reserves the right to give prior written approval over all uses of the Trademarks by XLI.

The parties acknowledge and understand the significance of protecting their respective trademarks' goodwill. Therefore, WCC agrees not to claim any goodwill or other rights developed during XLI's use of WCC's trademarks. Instead, any goodwill developed shall remain with XLI.

original: 2. Term and Termination 1. Term. Unless earlier terminated, this Agreement shall take effect on December 1st, 2015 and shall expire on November 30, 2016 .
modified:
2. Term and Termination
1. Duration. This Agreement will commence on December 1st, 2015, and may be extended at the discretion of either party, without any obligation to do so, until such time as either party elects to terminate the Agreement. The Agreement shall continue in effect unless terminated by either party upon providing written notice not less than 30 days prior to the desired termination date.

original: 1. Any significant changes to the Benefits Schedule which cannot be cured as stated in Section 2.2 (Termination upon Breach) 2. By mutual consent of WCC and XLI to pursue other arrangements.
ollama_generated: 1. The party responsible for any substantial modifications to the Benefits Schedule shall have the discretion, at their sole discretion, to implement such changes without prior consent from the other party, provided that such alterations do not result in a material detriment to the receiving party's interests as reasonably understood at the time of contract execution. However, the affected party retains the right to terminate this agreement if they deem the changes unacceptable and no resolution can be reached through negotiations within a reasonable timeframe.

original: 5. Indemnification 5.1 WCC shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless XLI, and its respective affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents and representatives, from any and all claims, losses, damages, expenses, costs and other liabilities to any person or entity ("Claims") arising out of, relating to or in connection with: (i) the breach by WCC of any of the representations and warranties made by WCC in this Agreement or the failure by WCC to fulfill any of its covenants set forth herein, and (ii) the use by XLI (as approved by WCC) of the WCC Trademarks pursuant to Section 1.1.1, above. Notwithstanding any other provision herein, under no circumstances shall WCC be liable for any claims arising out of the negligent acts or omissions of XLI or third parties.
ollama_generated:
5. Defense and Indemnity

5.1 XLI, along with its affiliated entities, officers, directors, workers, agents, and representatives, shall be defended, indemnified, and protected from any claims, losses, damages, expenses, costs, or other liabilities ("Claims") stemming from: (i) WCC's violations of the promises and guarantees made by WCC in this Agreement, or WCC's failure to meet its commitments as outlined herein, and (ii) XLI's authorized usage of the WCC Trademarks, as detailed in Section 1.1.1.

It is important to note that, despite any other provisions within this agreement, WCC will not be held responsible for any claims arising from the negligent actions or inactions of XLI or third parties.

original: 5.2 XLI shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless WCC, and its affiliates, officers, directors, shareholders, members, employees, agents and representatives, from any and all Claims arising out of, relating to or in connection with: (i) the breach by XLI of any of the representations and warranties made by XLI in this Agreement or the failure by XLI to fulfill any of its covenants set forth herein and (ii) the use by WCC (as approved by XLI) of the "XLI" trademark pursuant to Section 1.1.2, above. Notwithstanding any other provisions herein, under no circumstances shall XLI be liable for any Claims arising out of the negligent acts or omissions of WCC.
ollama_generated:
5.2. WCC and its affiliates, officers, directors, shareholders, members, employees, agents, and representatives shall be indemnified, defended, and held harmless by XLI from any and all Claims arising out of, relating to, or in connection with: (i) the non-fulfillment by WCC of any representations, warranties, or covenants made by WCC in this Agreement, (ii) the use by XLI (with WCC's approval) of the "WCC" trademark as per Section 1.1.2, above. Notably, under no circumstances shall WCC be liable for any Claims arising from the negligent acts or omissions of XLI.

In this revised clause, the responsibility and liability are shifted to XLI for certain breaches or non-fulfillments by WCC, while maintaining a professional and realistic tone.

original: 8.3 Non Waiver . No term hereof may be waived or modified except in writing and signed by both parties. The failure or delay by either party in enforcing any of its rights under this Agreement shall not be deemed a continuing waiver or modification thereof, and either party may within the time provided by applicable law, commence appropriate legal proceedings to enforce any or all such rights.
ollama_generated: 8.3 Right to Modify and Waive. Any provision within this Agreement can only be amended or forgo in writing, signed by both parties. Absence of either party's immediate action to enforce its rights under this Agreement does not constitute a permanent concession or alteration of the terms, and either party reserves the prerogative, within the timeframe permitted by law, to instigate legal action to uphold these rights.

original: 8.6 Provisions not Construed Against Party Drafting Agreement . This Agreement shall be deemed to have been drafted by all parties and in the event of a dispute, no party hereto shall be entitled to claim that any provisions should be construed against any other party by reason of the fact that it was drafted by one particular party.
ollama_generated: 8.6 Interpretation Clause: This Agreement is presumed to have been collectively authored by all parties. In the event of a disagreement, no party shall be allowed to argue that any provisions should be interpreted against them due to their drafting, as it is understood that the document was equally crafted by all involved.

original: 8.7 Force Majeure . Neither party shall be liable for any failure of or delay in the performance of its respective obligations under this Agreement to the extent such failure or delay is due to circumstances beyond its reasonable control, including (without limitation) fires, floods, wars, civil disturbances, sabotage, accidents, insurrections, blockades, embargoes, storms, explosions, labor disputes, acts of any governmental, and/or any other acts of God or a public enemy, nor shall any such failure or delay give either party the right to terminate this Agreement. Each party shall use good faith efforts to minimize the duration and consequence of any failure of or delay in performance resulting from a force majeure.
ollama_generated: 8.7 Exception from Liability for Delays (Force Majeure). Both parties are relieved from liability for any delays or failures to fulfill their obligations under this Agreement when such events are due to unforeseen circumstances that are not reasonably within the control of either party, including but not limited to fires, floods, wars, civil unrest, sabotage, accidents, strikes, governmental actions, acts of nature, or other unpredictable events. This relief from liability does not grant either party the right to terminate this Agreement. Instead, each party will make reasonable efforts to mitigate the impact and duration of any such delays or failures, working cooperatively to restore performance as soon as practicable.

original: (iii) Certain technical and other information provided by both XLI and WCC pursuant to this Agreement pertains to confidential matters and trade secrets of XLI and WCC, and their respective parent, subsidiary, and affiliate companies, and is provided to each other in furtherance of internal development efforts. Both parties agree that they will treat any information received from the other party, directly or indirectly, in strict confidence, will not disclose such information to any person, except to its employees and agents who have an immediate "need to know ", and will promptly return such information, including all copies or reproductions thereof, to the other party upon termination of this Agreement or at such other time as may be reasonably requested in writing. Confidential information shall not include information which: (i) was known to a party without confidentiality restrictions prior to receipt hereunder, (ii) was or becomes generally publicly known through no fault of the WCC, or (iii) subsequent to receipt hereunder, is made available to a party without confidentiality restrictions by a third party who is legally entitled to do so and who is under no obligation to either party hereunder to maintain the confidentiality of such information.
ollama_generated:
(iii) Technical and other details disclosed by XLI and WCC in accordance with this Agreement relate to proprietary data and secret processes belonging to XLI, WCC, and their respective parent entities, subsidiaries, and associates. Both parties acknowledge their obligation to preserve the confidentiality of such information, restricting its dissemination solely to their own employees or agents who possess a legitimate necessity to know. Any shared information must be returned promptly to the other party upon the termination of this Agreement, or at any time upon written request, unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties. Confidential information shall not encompass:
   (i) Information that was known to either party without confidentiality restrictions before receiving it under this agreement,
   (ii) Information that becomes publicly available through no fault of WCC, or
   (iii) Information received from a third party who is lawfully permitted to share such information and has no obligations to maintain its confidentiality towards either party under this agreement.
